fields.description:
In our docs regarding changing the project key pattern here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Configuring+Project+Keys

We specify a few unsafe options, but also state that it's possible to change these key patterns. GreenHopper on the other hand does not support any key patterns other than the default:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3166

Can we add a warning to state that this will break GreenHopper if you change the key pattern?
fields.summary: Changing JIRA Project Key Patterns Not Supported by GreenHopper

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24976].
  {panel}

We have a long list of issues caused by the warning we give went a form is partially filled and you navigate away from the page without finishing.

There are three ways to fix this that I can see:
# Remove the dirty warnings javascript all together and rely on the browser to warn the user.
# Make the dirty form code selective in that you have a list of the forms it applies to.
# Make the dirty form code less picky eg. 3 form elements have changed or a text field has an additional 140 characters.

I kinda like the third option but initially want to investigate the best way to go forward.
fields.summary: Improve Dirty Forms handling.

fields.description:
For example, a comment with \u0081 comes across directly as a single character, rather than being encoded as a six character escape sequence.

See these URLS to understand why JIRA is doing the wrong thing:
    http://json.org/
    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode_control_characters
fields.summary: REST API does not escape unicode control characters

fields.description:
In 4.4 we added a page to let system admins change advanced application properties (such as the project keys regex). This is good in that it gives more power to the system admin.

This is bad because it doesn't help keep the admin from messing the system (which a bad regex will do in many subtle and confusing ways).

We need to find a way to validate:

the project key regex. My current thinking is it run the regex against:
existing project keys. they should all match the regex)].
project keys that would be a problem for JIRA (eg. ending in a dash, other punctuation in the project key, not starting with an alpha etc). None of these should match the regex.
The date and date&time fields. The problem being the javascript and java patterns must match the same date format.
I am not sure the best appoach for this yet.
While we are playing with this page I would like to work on the UI to provide hints as to what is editable, how to edit it, and when it has been successfully edited (in the hopes of expanding this table to be used on the general configuration later). We should look and see if the restful table is a good drop in replacement or not.
fields.summary: Validation and UI improvements of the Advanced configuration screen.
Ability to Show Only Issues Without Subtasks
Add Support for Mozilla Firefox 5 in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24968].
  {panel}

In some situation non critical bundled plguin may not be initiated correctly. That will cause the application to lock up and fail to start up.

For e.g. if on upgrade the plugin got disabled due to some errors, on any subsequent startups JIRA reports:
{noformat}
********************************************************************************
JIRA 4.3.4 build: 620 started. You can now access JIRA through your web browser.
********************************************************************************

2011-06-26 15:26:23,639 main FATAL      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] 

***********************************************************************************************************************
The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started: FishEye Plugin (com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin)
***********************************************************************************************************************

2011-06-26 15:26:23,661 main FATAL      [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher] Skipping, JIRA is locked.
2011-06-26 15:26:23,661 main INFO      [atlassian.jira.scheduler.JiraSchedulerLauncher] JIRA Scheduler not started: JIRA startup checklist failed.
2011-06-26 15:26:24,118 main FATAL      [jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher] 

******************************************
JIRA startup failed, JIRA has been locked.
******************************************
{noformat}

The locking mechanism was introduced due to [JRA-22633|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22633].

The only way to fix this problem is to change the status of the plugin with help of db manipulation.
fields.summary: Exclude non critical plugins from being included the failed initiation check

fields.description:
Since it does not appear that JIRA is going to support component hierarchies in the near future, we are planning on creating parent/child relationships in Greenhopper. Parent components will be created in JIRA solely for the purpose of implementing structure to the hierarchy - we do not want our clients to be able to select these components for logging issues against.

Please implement view permissions for components (e.g. administrator allows Component A to be visible only to the group "developers" and Component B visible to "all-users")

This may at least keep some JIRA users happy until JIRA adopts the component hierarachy, that so many users are crying out for....
fields.summary: Enable View permissions for components

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24961].
  {panel}

Story: a JIRA administrator (or JIRA user) wants to perform some set of actions many hundreds of times. These actions are available via the web to the user. 
Many administrators open a new tab for each action in turn, because there is no easy way to automate bulk operations, e.g. changing a scheme on a project.

Aim: make JIRA configuration and maintenance scale as well as JIRA data does by making it easier for users to automate actions in JIRA

Currently administrators have a few choices. Users have fewer choices. All these choices are:

1. UI tools (Selenium) - pretty crude and sensitive to UI changes
2. A SOAP/REST plugin to expose an API to execute the set of operations, and then use a client-side script. This is probably the most common approach right now.
3. A plugin to execute just that set of operations - can be a fair amount of work, not clear which internal APIs to use or how to use them
4. A Jelly script - outdated, little support in the last three years
5. (JIRA 4.3 and later) Speakeasy is the client-side approach to doing this in the browser, but it doesn't allow access to all the actions that administrators or users may want to use.

There are at least two plugins available that let you execute Groovy, JRuby, Jython etc scripts inside JIRA. They are Script Runner (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/6820) and JIRA REST CLI (http://leonardinius.blogspot.com/2011/03/release-announcement-jira-rest-cli-05.html and https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/40268)


This issue is the result of a number of discussions at Summit, plus feedback received on "Practical JIRA Administration" (O'Reilly, 2011).
fields.summary: The Hundred Tab Problem
Bulk Edit Group Members: Please display user full name in Group Members box

fields.description:
There's a bug when adding a FishEye 2.6.x application link in JIRA 4.2.x:

When you go to {{JIRA Administration >> System >> Trusted Applications}} and add a Trusted App to FishEye, you need to insert the *Base URL* for FishEye and click on *Send Request*. After that, you're redirected to another page where you can see/edit other details (they are automatically filled for you, in fact): *Application ID*, *Timeout*, *IP Address Matches* and *URL Paths to Allow*.

However, JIRA auto-fills the *URL Paths to Allow* incorrectly. It adds:
{noformat}
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest
/secure/RunPortlet
/rest
/rpc/soap
/plugins/servlet/streams
/plugins/servlet/applinks
{noformat}
This is not incorrect, in fact, if you're trying to integrate with older FishEye instances, such as 2.5.x.

However, to communicate with newer versions of FishEye, such as 2.6.1, it should add more some paths, according to [the Dragon Slayer documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Dragons+Stage+5+-+Get+JIRA+and+FishEye+Talking#DragonsStage5-GetJIRAandFishEyeTalking-Step3.ConfiguretheFishEyePlugininJIRA]:
{noformat}
/secure/CreateSubTaskIssueDetails.jspa
/browse/
/rest
/plugins/servlet/applinks/whoami
/plugins/servlet/streams
/rpc/soap
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest
/secure/RunPortlet
{noformat}

But the problem is that, as mentioned before, these fields are automatically filled, so the customer usually doesn't check it the information is correct. He *trusts* that it was filled correctly.

The integration error this problem causes is that users are unable to create JIRA issues from Crucible reviews. This is the stacktrace generated in the FishEye logs:

We do this for XSRF protection.  Basically you should be able to subvert the web sudo mechanism via a HTTP header.

This posts shows the use case

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/1273/jira-jelly-runner-via-cron-in-v4-3-4

Scripts don't suffer this problem.  The need your username and password to run at all.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24954].
  {panel}

Hi, this is probably a bit unusual, but I'm filing a ticket to provide you guys with a solution. Your article on this was a huge help in correlating the fact that these crashes weren't unique to our product, so thought you'd be interested in the Java bug we've raised with Oracle, as these have caused significant problems for our clients:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/JIRA+with+GreenHopper+Crashes+Java+with+a+SIGSEGV+Fault+on+Linux+64bit+JVMs

The short summary is: stack overflows in Java native calls should never crash the JVM, unless you have your own native library that's deeply recursing. Crashes have been confirmed to be prevented with a -XX:StackShadowPages=20 on Linux x86_64 and may also address these on UltraSPAC (sparcv9).

Cheers!
Danny

Java bug: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=7059899

{quote}
As our clients have migrated to 64-bit JVMs we've seen a significant number of JVM crashes due to SIGSEGV on Unix platforms. These are spontaneous and do not trigger a HotSpot crash report. Each crash involved an application bug that caused deep recursion that should have resulted in a java.lang.StackOverflowError, for instance an infinite struts forward or a search continuance/referral loop during LDAP authentication. This affects both Solaris and Linux platforms, but a 64-bit JVM is always the common factor.

We referred to the Java SE Troubleshooting Guide section '4.1.3 Crash due to Stack Overflow' and found that likely, the StackShadowPages value is too small for these platforms. The guide discusses custom JNI libraries, however we're seeing these conditions in "normal" native calls, usually socket operations, reads or writes, which lead us to investigate further, as this should not be the case. According to the OpenJDK source the default on x84 platforms is 3, and is doubled to 6 on AMD64. There is a x86 Solaris value, seemingly to accomodate C++ compiler bugs on that platform, however our experience has shown that perhaps this is 

http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk6/jdk6/hotspot/file/9b013e207574/src/cpu/x86/vm/globals_x86.hpp
{code}
       60 #ifdef AMD64
       61 // Very large C++ stack frames using solaris-amd64 optimized builds
       62 // due to lack of optimization caused by C++ compiler bugs
       63 define_pd_global(intx, StackShadowPages, SOLARIS_ONLY(20) NOT_SOLARIS(6) DEBUG_ONLY(+2));
       64 #else
       65 define_pd_global(intx, StackShadowPages, 3 DEBUG_ONLY(+5));
       66 #endif // AMD64
{code}

We can only conclude that either 64-bit stack frames on AMD64 are generally far larger than their 32-bit equivalents or there's a problem with the way this value is calculated (I believe it's OS pagesize * StackShadowPages), allowing previously benign stack overflows in Java code to crash the JVM. Lab testing indicates that 17 was is the smallest StackShadowPages size that prevented the JVM from crashing with a segmentation fault. We have not confirmed the value on Solaris (UltraSPARC, we don't support our product on Solaris x86), however we have certainly seen these conditions affect both platforms. 

Others have also encountered 64-bit specific SIGSEGVs, bug 6346701 seems to report exactly this kind of condition, however I could not see an outright discussion anywhere that indicated that there could be a problem with the default shipping value or calculation of the number of pages to look ahead before invoking native methods:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/JIRA+with+GreenHopper+Crashes+Java+with+a+SIGSEGV+Fault+on+Linux+64bit+JVMs
http://fusesource.com/forums/thread.jspa?messageID=7830

We identified the offending threads using gdb, and jstack thread dumps identified the following two crash use cases:
 
Crash 1 - Two application methods that call each other recursively, executing database statements, causing overflow during Oracle thin driver socket read:

fields.description:
We came across this during a support case, but here's how we think it happened:

- JIRA 4.3+ set to sync with Crowd
- Crowd initially set the output lower case names and group names
- Memberships for users "Rob" and "Joe" get synced across as "rob" and "joe"

- Later we switch off the lower case output. Resync.
- Again, memberships for users "Rob" and "Joe" are being synced across, and JIRA does a lookup of the name "Rob", finds none and tries to add a membership entry for "rob" in "group" but can't add it due to the unique column key constraint of the membership table.
- The entire sync now fails, and does not continue.

- The original situation is an unlikely one to get into, but possible nonetheless, and it should be finding that match.
- The part that is causing us the most problems however, is that after it fails to insert this one entry, the entire sync fails. It is possible to miss out on 99% of the memberships being synced because of one failure, it should continue, perhaps letting us know what happened in the UI or the logs or both, but otherwise finish the sync.
fields.summary: When Syncing with Crowd fails due to a bad user it fails for everyone after that user, this should be more robust.

fields.description:
When viewing a large administration page, such as viewing list of 1000 projects in ViewProjects.jspa or 1000 custom fields in ViewCustomFields.jspa, Firefox 3.6 hangs (and may crash) while loading the Javascript and CSS.

This is reproduce-able in Firefox 3.5 and 3.6. In Firefox 4 and 5 it works with a blink of an eye.

Dieter Greiner, our JSP-80027 customer, has managed to get around this by modifying the jspa files by changing this 
{code}
<table id="custom-fields" class="aui aui-table-rowhover">
{code}

to this

{code}
<table id="custom-fields">
{code}

I have created this as critical as a customer with such large data cannot use Firefox 3.5 and 3.6 to administer JIRA with this performance issue, while these versions of Firefox are in the [supported list of browsers for JIRA 4.4|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms]

Thank you,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Performance issues in JIRA 4.4 RC1 in Firefox 3.6 with large pages

  {panel}

If you already have a filter loaded and you go to Manage Filters and click the +Subscribe+ or +1 Subscription+ link from another filter, the title of the page will still be for the filter you had previously loaded. This is very confusing because you have to trust that Jira actually will subscribe you to the filter whose link you clicked rather than the title you see.

+To Reproduce+
# load a filter like say, 'Good Bugs'
# Go to Manage Filters
# Click the +Subscribe+ link for a filter other than Good Bugs, like say the 'Interesting Improvements' filter

+Expected Result+
The title of that screen would say something like 'create a filter subscription for Interesting Improvements'

+Actual Result+
# At the top of the screen in the biggest print it says *Issue Navigator - Good Bugs* which really throws me because I swore I clicked +subscribe+ on the Interesting Improvements filter, not the Good Bugs filter.
!2 confusing title.png|thumbnail!
# If you click the Subscribe button, it turns out that all is actually ok and it's just the title is still revealing the active filter in the session rather than the filter that I clicked +subscribe+ for. 
# But now I see 2 different filter titles in the same screen which is also confusing.
!3 oh, but it's ok.png|thumbnail!

+More Information+
This doesn't occur in 4.1.2 because there is no additional "Issue Navigator - Filter Name" title in 4.1
fields.summary: Confusing title on screen following Click of 'subscribe' link from Manage Filters

fields.description:
JIRA does not use JDBC transactions when performing a bulk move or single issue move.  This can lead to workflow tables pointer mismatches like we saw recently on support.atlassian.com

However we do use JDBC transactions on Issue Transition and Bulk Workflow Migration.  So we have a code precedence for bits of code that move issues and their workflow state.

We should add the transaction support to the places where we changed workflow state.  

I realize that there is a much bigger question about using transactions in general however that is another issue and would have more profound consequences.  We should attack this piece meal to ensure the best result for the least impact.
fields.summary: Extend transaction support to BulkMove and MoveIssue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24943].
  {panel}

I able replicate this problem in JIRA 4.1.2 standalone. Steps to replicate the problem:

Create a custom field (e.g. Free Text Field (unlimited text) custom field type) that only associate to the sub-task issue type and also the screen (e.g. Sub-Task screen) that used by the sub-task.
Create a Testing Project (e.g. TST).
Create an issue and also with a sub-task under that issue.
Ensure there is a value being entered into that particular custom field.
Go to the Issue Navigator and use the following JQL query to list out all the sub-tasks under a specific parent task. For example:
project = Testing AND issuetype = Sub-task AND parent = "TST-1"
Go to Views > Excel (All Fields) to generate the Excel file.
The Excel file does not includes with the custom field.

*Other testing:- Add a column in Issue Navigator*

Go to Tools > Add Columns and add the custom field to be viewable in Issue Navigator.
Return to the Issue Navigator for the search result but the column is not added.
Try to generate the Excel report but the custom field still not exists in the Excel file.

*Successful testing*

If you use the following JQL query that lists out all the sub-tasks:
project = Testing AND issuetype = Sub-task
Generate the Excel report and the custom field will appear in the report.
fields.summary: Advanced Query view list results excel export doesn't include custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24937].
{panel}
This issue supercedes CWD-2515. I have had a chat with Olli Nevalainen and we agreed that this is a good improvement request for the behavior of JIRA when a user is deleted from the AD side or from Crowd.

Currently, the user would disappear from the JIRA user browser and will show up in gray color in the issues when he is the assignee of reporter. However, this may cause problems later on. I have witnessed one problem of it when retrieving SOAP remote issues which their assignee/reporter does not exist in JIRA due to him/her being deleted from LDAP/Crowd side. There may be more hidden problems about it.

Deleting a user who matches any of this criteria was never possible from the UI:
 # Assignee of any issue
 # Reporter of any issue
 # Lead of any project

Thus, I have raised this improvement request to keep the user in JIRA even after being deleted from the external user management system, but as an inactive user (he/she will not be able to log-in anyway).

Regards,
Ali
fields.summary: When a user is deleted in AD or Crowd, JIRA could keep the user in JIRA as an inactive user

I am interested in creating a workflow with a single 'active' issue at a time, enforced with state triggers. A timestamp when an issue changes from active to just open would be used to log time spent per issue, with no direct entry by the user. They could also, of course, 'log out' (poor word choice, since it would not be the same as logging out of Jira) to make no issue active.

Most of this can be cobbled together from existing custom fields and triggers. However, one thing I would like to do is track time spent on the 'new issue' screen as well. I'm not sure if the capability exists to track time before the issue is even created. I could simply be missing a feature, since I am new to Jira administration.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24926].
  {panel}

h4. Update

See [comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24926?focusedCommentId=259508&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-259508] for an update on what needs to be done to address this issue.

h4. Problem description:
I have noticed that when the documentation instructions are followed from here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0

Due to step 4 instructions:
{quote}
Tomcat does not come with some libraries required to run JIRA. To fix this, download

http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-4.3-tomcat-6x.zip
and copy the contained jars to Tomcat's lib/ directory. (Be sure to remove existing versions of these JAR before copying the new ones.)

    In particular, to prevent exceptions related to logging, please ensure that commons-logging-1.0.4.jar and log4j-1.2.15.jar are present in Tomcat's /lib/ directory. Also ensure that these files are not present in Tomcat's webapps/jira/WEB-INF/lib directory.

Additionally, if you are running Sun's distribution of Tomcat, download tomcat-dbcp.jar and copy it to the tomcat6/lib directory.
{quote}

The jar files below will end up in both of the directories:
* _<TOMCAT>\webapp\jira\WEB-INF\lib_
* _<TOMCAT>\lib_

| jcl-over-slf4j-1.5.8.jar |
| jul-to-slf4j-1.5.8.jar |
| slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar |
| slf4j-log4j12-1.5.8.jar |

h4. Impact analysis:
Due to this, JIRA may possibly encounter errors like:

{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: XSRF white list failure
{code}

Even if not, it does not make sense that there should be duplicate jar files accessible to JIRA.

h4. Suggested resolution:
* Either these jar files can be removed from the JIRA jars tomcat distribution libraries:
http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-4.3-tomcat-6x.zip
* Or the documentation needs to be updated to warn about these duplicates and ask the user to delete them if they exist.

_Note: tested with JIRA 4.3. The same problem may exist with massive amount of JIRA versions_

Thank you very much,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Remove duplicate JAR libraries from the "jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-X.Y-tomcat-6x.zip" (and "jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-X.Y-tomcat-5x.zip") files which are already included in the JIRA WAR distribution (or vice versa).

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24923].
  {panel}

There are a number of times when a simple totals row on find results would be incredibly useful.

Particularly, I would like to run a query for "all tasks assigned to Joe by version 0.8 that are Open" and see a total line at the bottom that tells me how much time is left in the estimated work column.

Also suitable for Story Points, Business Value, various estimations etc. 

Now, we do it through Greasemonkey scripting.

fields.description:
Steps needed to reproduce the problem:
# Create new LDAP User Directory.
# Sync it with LDAP server.
# Remove the created directory.
# Reviewing content of *cwd_user* or *cwd_grup* table disclose list of records created during the sync and left behind after the directory was deleted.

Despite that at first it may look as an insignificant problem, for big LDAP repositories we may have possibly thousands of orphaned records.

{noformat}
_Before:_
mysql> select ID, directory_name from cwd_directory;
+-------+-------------------------+
| ID    | directory_name          |
+-------+-------------------------+
|     1 | JIRA Internal Directory |
| 10001 | Active Directory server |
+-------+-------------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}
_After:_
{noformat}
mysql> select ID, directory_name from cwd_directory;
+-------+-------------------------+
| ID    | directory_name          |
+-------+-------------------------+
|     1 | JIRA Internal Directory |
+-------+-------------------------+
1 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}

{noformat}
mysql> select group_name, directory_id from cwd_group where directory_id=10001;
+-----------------------------------------+--------------+
| group_name                              | directory_id |
+-----------------------------------------+--------------+
| jira-users                              |        10001 |
| Enterprise Read-only Domain Controllers |        10001 |
| Schema Admins                           |        10001 |
| Distributed COM Users                   |        10001 |
+-----------------------------------------+--------------+
4 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}

{noformat}
mysql> select user_name, directory_id from cwd_user where directory_id=10001;
+---------------+--------------+
| user_name     | directory_id |
+---------------+--------------+
| Guest         |        10001 |
| krbtgt        |        10001 |
| Administrator |        10001 |
| jira          |        10001 |
| jirauser      |        10001 |
| testtest      |        10001 |
+---------------+--------------+
6 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Orphan data is left behind after removing LDAP directory

fields.description:
Currently we test very limited numbers of attributes while integrating with LDAP:
- Host & Port,
- Bind DN
no other parameters are tested which cause returning the false positive output of the test.

For example despite entering invalid Base DN we still return success.

!ldap_testing.png!

However simple typos in UI or misconfiguration on the LDAP side may cause directory fail.
Additionally, to the above we should test:
- LDAP Schema configuration,
- LDAP permission for write operations,
- Retrieve a sample user,
- Perform a test authentication (as possible in Crowd),

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

When starting JIRA it displays a HTTP 404, as below:
{noformat}
HTTP Status 404 -

type Status report

message

description The requested resource () is not available.

Apache Tomcat/6.0.32
{noformat}

The following is displayed in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat}
JIRA 4.3.4 build: 620 started. You can now access JIRA through your web browser.
********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************

2011-06-27 11:45:24,728 main FATAL      [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher] A RuntimeException occurred during UpgradeLauncher servlet context initialisation - Failed to verify the license..
com.atlassian.extras.common.LicenseException: Failed to verify the license.
	at com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v2.Version2LicenseDecoder.checkAndGetLicenseText(Version2LicenseDecoder.java:186)
	at com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v2.Version2LicenseDecoder.doDecode(Version2LicenseDecoder.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.extras.decoder.api.AbstractLicenseDecoder.decode(AbstractLicenseDecoder.java:14)
	at com.atlassian.extras.decoder.api.DelegatingLicenseDecoder.decode(DelegatingLicenseDecoder.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.extras.core.DefaultLicenseManager.decodeLicense(DefaultLicenseManager.java:63)
{noformat}

h3. Cause

The License key stored in database is invalid and the above error is shown in the browser page when the user attempts to access JIRA.

h3. Workaround

(!) Always [back up|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data] your data before performing any modification to the database. If possible, try your modifications on a test server.

# Make sure you have your license keys available from your [my.atlassian.com|https://my.atlassian.com/] account.
# Stop JIRA.
# Identify license keys in the database with the following SQL:
{code:SQL}
SELECT * FROM propertyentry e
JOIN propertytext t ON e.id = t.id
WHERE property_key LIKE '%icense%' or property_key like '%LICENSE%' or property_key like '%License%';
{code}
# Remove them with the following SQL:
{code:SQL}
DELETE FROM propertyentry WHERE id = <ID from previous SQL>;
{code}
# Start JIRA.
# Manually enter all the license keys, as in [Updating your JIRA License Details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Updating+your+JIRA+License+Details] and also through the UPM.
# Test that JIRA and your plugins are working with the license keys.
# Restart JIRA.

h3. Expected Behaviour
JIRA should able to handle this situation and prompt a page for user to insert valid license key rather than generate a 404 and cause the instance to be unusable.
fields.summary: JIRA cannot be accessed and displays a 404 instead of a License Error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi,

When searching for tickets which contain german umlauts it is not possible to find these when searching with typical recoded umlauts.

Example: A ticket holds the word Rückläufer. I would like to search for it by the phrase 'ruecklaeufer'. The queried ticket is not returned.

The vice versa issue also would be nice to have addressed: ticket holds the word Ruecklaeufer, I want to find it with the query rückläufer.

Please see below to understand the request :
||Issue text||Search term||Match|| 
|Rückläufer|Rückläufer|Yes| 
|Rückläufer|Rucklaufer|Yes|
|Rückläufer|ruecklaeufer|No| (feature being requested)
|ruecklaeufer|Rückläufer|No| (feature being requested)

Thanks,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Search for phrases with 'ue', 'ae', 'oe' does not return respective german umlauts in result set
JNDI database installation option

fields.description:
Since Crowd Embedded was introduced in JIRA 4.3 making the full integration with LDAP possible. Some of our customers don't have any longer a need for Crowd.

Atlassian should consider providing a migration path allowing those users to achieve their goal.

Currently, this task can be only achieved by users with significant programming experience with help of APIs.

Feedback from customers in SAC

bq. We are using Jira 4.1 with Crowd and as I prepare for the upgrade (and server move) I need to know if Crowd install will be necessary. I understand the LDAP functionality is now build into Jira so what shall I do?

or

bq. How do I go about switching to non-Crowd use when I migrate? I have the standalone 4.3 version up on our new server and prefer to import my xml backup. However shouldn't I do something about LDAP integration before importing? The import will expect I am using Crowd still.
fields.summary: Provide migration path from Crowd to Crowd Embedded

fields.description:
The JIRA interface has a very inconsistent modal nature to it.  There's a hidden concept of the "current project" that is used in some places but not others.  This is hugely confusing.

Please get rid of the modal nature of the main navigation buttons.  When I click on projects (without clicking on the drop-down part of it), the expected response is showing me ALL the Projects I have access to -- not just a single Project as it currently does.  Otherwise the link should be labeled "Project" not "Projects".  

After all, when I click on "Administration" it doesn't show me the admin page for the "current Project" -- it takes me to the Global admin page by default.  And when I click on Issues it doesn't take me to the last issue I worked on -- it takes me to the issues navigator view where I can look at many issues.  And when I click on Dashboards it doesn't take me to just one Dashboard but to a page where I can tab to any of my favorite Dashboards.
fields.summary: to be consisten w/ rest of UI navigation the "Projects" navigation link should display a list of ALL your Projects -- not just the last Project you worked with

fields.description: Sometimes it would be helpful to display attachments in the order in which they are attached rather than forcing them into alphabetical order.  A series of images, for instance, sometimes makes better sense in a particular order that may not be alphabetical order (see JRA-24908, for example -- I wanted the picture of a folder with multiple items to appear before the picture of the window for attaching files to JIRA).  Sometimes the historical order of entries is important.  Thanks for considering this!
fields.summary: Display Attachments in Order Attached rather than Forcing them into Alphabetical Order

fields.description: When there are multiple files to be attached to an issue and they are all in the same folder, it would be faster to be able to select them all at once through the file dialog box rather than having to select one at a time.  Thanks for considering this!
fields.summary: Allows Multiple Files to be Selected at Once When Attaching Files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24907].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When applying a label, JIRA will not find existing labels that have a different case:

!Label_search_not_case-insensitive.jpg|thumbnail!

Basic search has the same behavior:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-13 at 10.05.41.jpg|thumbnail!
 !Screen Shot 2015-05-13 at 10.05.33.jpg|thumbnail!

An *advanced* search, using JQL, will find all labels and is case insensitive.
{code:java}
labels="it_maintenance"{code}
returns all results.
h3. Suggested Solution

Labels should be case insensitive. That is, if an issue already has a label *Australia* then it shouldn't allow a second label *AUSTRALIA*

There isn't any use to be able to label an issue as *Australia*, *australia* and *AUSTRALIA* because searching for the word Australia in any case will return the issue.
fields.summary: labels should be case insensitive

fields.summary: Documentation missing for some field types for custom fields.

fields.description:
The Priority field normally does not allow a null value, but if you set a Post Function in your workflow to modify the Priority, it can set the Priority to none.

If you perform that post function, then later try and edit the issue, since the priority field does not support the null value, the edit screen will set the priority value to its default value and you won't be able to make any changes without also changing the priority.

This is inconsistent behaviour, either the priority field should allow null values or the post function should not be able to set them.
fields.summary: Post Function in Workflow allows Priority to be cleared

fields.description:
# Create issue security scheme with no secutity levels.
# Assign said scheme to a project.
# (DEFECT) Go to the "Issue Security" tab for that project. There will be a message saying "Issue Security is currently not enabled for this project". This message is wrong, issue security is enabled but there are no levels configured.

We need to consider the two cases:

# When there is no issue security level associated with a project. This currently works (/)
# When the issue security level associated with a project has no levels. (x)

!issue_security.png!
fields.summary: The Message on the "Issue Security" tab when a project has a security scheme but there are not levels in the scheme is slightly misleading.

fields.description:
This issue could be linked with [#JRA-16098], however we're hoping there's another way to configure the columns on the application side at a project level instead of through the backend configuration for the whole suite.  From reading [#JRA-16098], it seems as though that is only a solution if the full suite of projects is okay with using the same column configuration instead of being able to configure it on project to project basis.

I submitted a ticket through your Support JIRA (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-83473) instance and they suggested I create an improvement ticket so it can go through a review and hopefully be selected for an upcoming release!
fields.summary: Sub-task list view user-configurable (add/remove/reposition columns)

fields.description:
When writing JQL in advanced search mode, Auto-complete does not work for fields that are defined to a specific issue type.

To reproduce the problem:
1. Turn on JQL Auto-Complete if it isn't already on.
2. Create a field of type Select List.
3. Assign the field any issue type and all projects.
4. Associate the field with at least one screen.
5. Add several options to the field.
6. Go to the Issue Navigator and create a new query in Advanced mode.
7. Use your new field in your JQL and notice that auto-complete is working.
8. Reconfigure your field so is now associated with a specific issue type.
9. Go to the Issue Navigator and create a new query in Advanced mode.
10. Use your new field in your JQL and notice that auto-complete no longer works.
fields.summary: Auto-complete doesn't work when a field is associated with a specific issue type.

Add a "Select All" button to the Retain column while changing issue types

fields.description:
If we have two users, UserA and UserB, and put both of them into their own project roles, RoleA and RoleB, then under project allow both of these roles to be Project Admins, then these users cannot remove one another from the Project Admin role. The error is also misleading:

"You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role."

I've tested this in all the supported versions of JIRA and it's the same across them all.
fields.summary: Project Admins cannot remove other Project Admins from the Project Role

fields.description:
The webwork configuration registry code looks up the view of any action.  This is really an unbounded ste of data.

However the JIRA applications properties configurator has a go at looking up this value anways even though it can handle it

2011-06-23 12:15:08,033 http-8090-5 admin 735x929x1 1irnuir /secure/CreateIssue.jspa 1ms "SELECT ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, propertytype FROM PUBLIC.propertyentry WHERE ENTITY_NAME='jira.properties' AND ENTITY_ID='1' AND PROPERTY_KEY='CreateIssue.success'"

2011-06-23 12:15:08,033 http-8090-5 admin 735x929x1 1irnuir /secure/CreateIssue.jspa 1ms "SELECT ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, propertytype FROM PUBLIC.propertyentry WHERE ENTITY_NAME='jira.properties' AND ENTITY_ID='1' AND PROPERTY_KEY='CreateIssue.none'"

This results in an SQL statement and a a PropertySet cache entry.  That cached entry repesents a value whcih is "I dont know" so JIRA is using memory to remember that it doesnt know somehting and then returning a "I dont know exception".

We need to do this smarter.

We should NOT respond to these keys.  We can either look at the key and decide that its jira. or webwork. and only respond then OR we can prefix the webwork view look ups to be some like view.CreateIssue.none and then chomp the view. bit later so that the other configurators can skip them!
fields.summary: Webwork Configuration mechanism induces unnecessary SQL statements and hence hurts performance

fields.description:
A customer support case had 1000s of these entries.  We know it can happen and we dont need a stack trace to work out why.  We should get rid of this as a 500 or redo the work to allow JFreeChart images to be served multiple times (whcih was kybshed because of OAUTH problems) which is recorded some where on JAC but I could find it.

fields.description:
Typo in title when editing condition for items ending in the wording "Condition".

Steps to reproduce:

_Administration_ > Global Settings, _Workflows_ > select a Workflow link under Schemes(an inactive on so it can be edited), at the "View Workflows for [Workflowname] Scheme" choose workflow,  select any item under _Transitions_, Edit the transitions Condition, choose a new Permission Condition (if none is there), edit that newly created and it is displayed "Update parameters of the _Permission Condition_ *Condition* for this transition."
fields.summary: Typo in the "Update parameters of the Permission Condition for this transition"

h3. Cause

Having Delegated LDAP Authentication and 'Logging and Profiling' enabled causes JIRA to throw a 500 error upon user creation.

h3. To Replicate

* JIRA is setup with Delegated LDAP Authentication
** Position of this directory does not matter, it could be above or below the Internal Directory
** Full LDAP integration does not cause this. Neither does LDAP with internal group management.
* Logging and Profiling is enabled
* Adding a new user to any directory results in the mentioned error
* This occurs in both 4.3.3 and 4.3.4

h3. Workaround

Disable logging and profiling as in [Logging and Profiling|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling].

h3. Notes

There is a performance impact to throwing this exception consistently in larger instances and is addressed in JRA-39770.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24883].
  {panel}

Hi there,

There is a little mistake here I believe:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-5.1ConfigureyourapplicationservertoconnecttoSQLServer

Look for the yellow box message:
{quote}
	If you have a named instance, your string may look like url="jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://localhost:1433/jiradb;instance=instance_name"
{quote}

As far as I can see in [SQL server 2008 documentation|http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms378428.aspx], [there is no property|http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms378988.aspx] which is named "instance". Please correct me if I am wrong. Kindly fix the documentation as necessary.

Cheers,
Ali
Atlassian Support

fields.description:
Related to:
* https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AJS-515
* https://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-4683

We have seen an issue in Studio where the AJS.conglomerate.cookie grows so large that it causes requests to FishEye to fail. This is because JIRA is served from context path / and FishEye from /source/, so all of JIRA's cookies are also sent in requests to FishEye. FishEye, via Jetty, imposes a maximum limit on request headers that can be exceeded due to this issue.

As of JIRA 4.3 (according to JRADEV-4683), this cookie is no longer used by JIRA/AG, but it also isn't automatically cleared or compacted, so it still affects users who have an oversized cookie until they manually delete it. It would be better if JIRA could automatically compact it.

h3. Workaround

Refer to [AUI-515|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AUI-515] for a workaround on this issue.
fields.summary: JIRA can create a very large AJS.conglomerate.cookie

# Use quick search to search for issues that results in more than one page being shown

# Results start on the page from last search 
# i.e: If you CTRL-clicked an issue on page 2, new results start on page 2

# Results start on page 1 for a new search always.
